Issues.Title: Include the expression in the ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

When ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError is thrown, it logs the previous value and the current value and a stack trace. However, it is difficult to see in the stack trace which component is causing the error.

### Proposed solution

Add the expression that threw the error into the message. This will make it clear at a glance where the problem is.

### Alternatives considered

Add the template file that threw the error (can get this from the stack trace) into the message. This will show you what file name to look for as you are scanning the stack trace for it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Include the expression in the ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError" (#50272)

Issues.Title: After hydration, all http calls are still cached
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core, Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Maybe I'm missing something, but, 
setting `provideClientHydration() ` in the app module causes all http requests done with HttpClient to be cached.
I get that this is needed to do rehydration, but after hydradion httpclient should just work as expected, that is not cache requests.

To reproduce:

1. set provideClientHydration() in app module.

2. do some same http requests with httpClient

3. Requests are cached, no actual http call is made.

Issues.Title: fix(core): fix `Self` flag inside embedded views with custom injectors
Issues.Body:
When an embedded view injector is present anywhere above a node in the tree, the `Self` flag was effectively ignored. With this change, embedded view injectors are not checked at all when the `Self` flag is present, because resolution should stop at the current node before reaching any embedded view injector(s).

Fixes #49959

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
`@Self` is ignored when using `createEmbeddedView` with a custom injector.

Issue Number: #49959


## What is the new behavior?
`@Self` is no longer ignored when using `createEmbeddedView` with a custom injector.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

I initially made a change to `lookupTokenUsingEmbeddedInjector` so that it would bail out after checking the current node if the `Self` flag was set, but I think skipping the embedded view injector lookup entirely makes more sense, and it avoids a case where the current node injector would be checked twice when both the `Self` and `Optional` flags are set.

I called this a "fix", but I could see how someone could've become reliant on this behavior in the last year or so since this feature was released. Is that enough to call this a breaking change?

I'm not certain about this, but I think there might be a similar issue with the `Host` flag and embedded view injectors. I don't see any special handling of the `Host` flag in the `lookupTokenUsingEmbeddedInjector` function, so I assume that if you created a hierarchy like `node -> embeddedView -> node -> embeddedView -> node` and used `@Host` on that last node, it would reach all the way up to the top node (past its "host") to find the token it was looking for. I ran out of time to look into this today, but I can take a look next week.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): fix `Self` flag inside embedded views with custom injectors" (#50270)

Issues.Title: Server side rendering not serving link stylesheets in index.html or CSS
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

platform-browser, platform-server, Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I have a project upgraded to angular 16, with SSR enabled and Angular material integrated.

The issue I have is that the Server Side rendering not load properly the CSS files, changing the media types from `this.media='all'` to `this.media='print'`

My index.html has this line of code:

```
<link rel="stylesheet" href="material.5c8ff7095e201185.css" media="print" onload="this.media='all'"><noscript><link rel="stylesheet" href="material.5c8ff7095e201185.css"></noscript><link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.f2a9e6ffd091c89e.css" media="print" onload="this.media='all'"><noscript><link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.f2a9e6ffd091c89e.css"></noscript></head>
```

When I run the server locally with `node .\server\main.js` (or on Lambda function), the `styles.f2a9e6ffd091c89e.css` is not served.
What I see in the return HTML is as following:
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/1130664/339bca16-9f5d-4f8a-a276-1ee03197da4e)



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://test1.homezone.al/properties/sale

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Link styles are not loaded.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.0
Node: 18.15.0
Package Manager: npm 9.5.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 16.0.0
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, material, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-server, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.0
@nguniversal/builders           16.0.0
@nguniversal/express-engine     16.0.0
@schematics/angular             16.0.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```


### Anything else?

After some extensive debugging found out that the issue is related to change in this line of angular universal:
https://github.com/angular/universal/blob/main/modules/common/engine/src/engine.ts#L105

Opened a related issue in the package:
https://github.com/angular/universal/issues/3128
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Server side rendering not serving link stylesheets in index.html or CSS" (#50269)

Issues.Title: Allow on the fly DatePipe default settings change.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

common

### Description

I know we can change the defaults by setting the DATE_PIPE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS token. But in my case the date time format and the used timezone depends on the user that's logged in. 

I would like to be able to set the defaults after the app has initialised. 

Now I have to override the default Date Pipe (and use an async pipe to wait for the users' settings).

### Proposed solution

Allow an observable or Promise to be used instead of hardcoded strings.

### Alternatives considered

Or have some sort of service that can change the global settings in realtime..
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow on the fly DatePipe default settings change." (#50268)

Issues.Title: Allow angular elements to support extends feature of customElements.define
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? elements ### Description Today we can convert angular component into WebComponent using `createCustomElement` API from `@angular/elements` However this only creates WebComponent extending `HTMLElement` interface internally. WebComponent specification also allows us to create WebComponent by extending specific HTMLElement (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/is). e.g ```ts class MyWebComponent extends HTMLParagraphElement {} ``` Angular's `createCustomElement` should also provide a way to do similar. This will allow developers to use angular component as a webcomponent in following manner as well. `

` ### Proposed solution add another generic type with `createCustomElement` which can be used to extend the WebComponent class. ```ts export abstract class NgElement

extends P { } ``` ### Alternatives considered Currently there is no alternate to this problem
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow angular elements to support extends feature of customElements.define" (#50255)

Issues.Title: feat(http): Introduction of the `fetch` Backend for the `HttpClient`
Issues.Body:
This commit introduces a new `HttpBackend` implentation which makes requests using the fetch API

This feature is a developer preview and is opt-in.
It is enabled by setting the providers with `provideHttpClient(withFetch())`.

Currently the report progress is not implemented and using `reportProgress: true` will throw an error.  

NB: The fetch API is experimental on Node but available without flags from Node 18 onwards.
NB2: The tests provided in the PR won't run, as `fetch` is not available on the node version provided by the bazel workspace (`16.14`)

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Feature

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [x] No
- [ ] 


Closes https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/27689

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): correctly generate serviceworker hashes for binary assets
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based build system with the service worker enabled, binary assets were unintentionally being hashed with the assumption of UTF-8 encoding. The assets are now hashed directly to ensure correct output hashes.

Closes #25200

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update angular" (#25196)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): normalize Vite dev-server Windows asset paths
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with the Vite-based development server on Windows, source asset paths were previously not normalized prior to being included in request URLs. This could result in invalid asset request URLs due to invalid path segment separators.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): normalize Vite dev-server Windows asset paths" (#25204)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): attempt relative global script read first in esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using a global script (`scripts` option) with the esbuild-based browser application builder, an attempt to read the script as a relative path from the workspace root will be performed first. This avoids the need to perform a potentially expensive module resolution attempt for files that are directly available and also ensures the relative paths are given priority over any potential modules with the same name. This matches prior behavior that also preferred relative paths.

Closes #25198
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): attempt relative global script read first in esbuild builder" (#25203)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support incremental TypeScript semantic diagnostics in esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with CLI caching enabled, TypeScript's `incremental`
option will also be enabled by default. A TypeScript build information file will be written after each build and
an attempt to load and use the file will be made during compilation setup. Caching is enabled by default within
the CLI and can be controlled via the `ng cache` command. This is the first use of persistent caching for the
esbuild-based builder. If the TypeScript `incremental` option is manually set to `false`, the build system will
not alter the value. This can be used to disable the behavior, if preferred, by setting the option to `false` in
the application's configured `tsconfig` file.
NOTE: The build information only contains information regarding the TypeScript compilation itself and does not
contain information about the Angular AOT compilation. TypeScript does not have knowledge of the AOT compiler
and it therefore cannot include that information in its build information file. Angular AOT analysis is still
performed for each build.

Initial profiling indicates this provides a ~20% improvement to warm build times for a production build of a newly generated project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support incremental TypeScript semantic diagnostics in esbuild builder" (#25192)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): minor sourcemap ignorelist improvements for esbuild builder
Issues.Body: This provides a minor performance benefit for the generation of the Chrome sourcemap ignorelist generation. Memory is shared were possible and string searching is reduced in certain cases.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): minor sourcemap ignorelist improvements for esbuild builder" (#25201)

Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

_No response_

### Description

My project uses SCSS and I had a selector like this:
```scss
#one {
  // styles here

  #two & {
    // styles here
  }
}
```

I decided to restructure it without thinking very hard apaprently and I un-nested that selector so that I had this:

```scss
#one {
  // styles here
}

#two & {
  // styles here
}
```

I didn't realize it was invalid at the time, but when I came back to my project to run `ng-build` or `ng serve` I got this extremely generic error

```
PS C:\Users\FiniteLooper\Projects\LyricConverter> ng serve
⠋ Generating browser application bundles (phase: building)...
node:internal/event_target:1010
  process.nextTick(() => { throw err; });

TypeError [Error]: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'column')
    at convertSourceSpan (C:\Users\FiniteLooper\Projects\LyricConverter\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\sass\worker.js:146:30)       
    at MessagePort.<anonymous> (C:\Users\FiniteLooper\Projects\LyricConverter\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\sass\worker.js:111:27) 
    at [nodejs.internal.kHybridDispatch] (node:internal/event_target:735:20)
```

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow forcing esbuild builder with dev-server
Issues.Body: To allow lower overhead trial of the developer preview of the esbuild-based builder system, the development server now has an option to force the usage of the esbuild-based build system while still retaining the default Webpack-based build system for the `build` command. The `forceEsbuild`/`--force-esbuild` option can be added to the `angular.json` options for the `serve` target or used on the command line, respectively. The `browser-esbuild` builder will be used to build the application using the options specified by the server configuration's `browserTarget` option. Unsupported build options will be ignored. If using a third-party builder, a warning will be issued but the build will still be attempted. Third-party builder usage in this context is considered unsupported and may result in unexpected behavior or build failures.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow forcing esbuild builder with dev-server" (#25180)

Issues.Title: bug(DateAdapter): `MAT_DATE_LOCALE` injection-type doesn't support most commonly used `string`
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

_(minor bug; and casting `as string` workaround present)_

In Angular 13 ([release tag 13.0.0-next.0](https://github.com/angular/components/releases/tag/13.0.0-next.0)) date-fns support was added to the DateAdapter. 
Overall a great change, but today I encountered an issue with the `MAT_DATE_LOCALE` being type `InjectionToken<{}>` instead of the previous `InjectionToken<string>`, which was changed when the date-fns support was added.

The minor issue occurs when I try to use the Angular 14's `inject(...)` function call instead of constructor DI-injection, where our previous `@Optional() @Inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE) dateLocale: string | null` constructor argument cannot be changed to `private readonly dateLocale: string | null = inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE, {optional: true});` without an additional `as string` cast.

In the pull-request (https://github.com/angular/components/pull/23262), I do see the following two comments mentioning it had been discussed the Monday prior, but I'm curious what has been discussed in that case?

https://github.com/angular/components/pull/23262#pullrequestreview-717428750
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/5364335/0f0569a3-6f31-4d0c-96f7-de641ceff810)

### Reproduction

Step to reproduce:
- Add `private readonly dateLocale: string | null = inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE, {optional: true});` to any Angular TS file (preferably a DateAdapter, but doesn't matter too much for the reproduction scenario).

### Expected Behavior

`string` should be one of the allowed types of `inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE)`. Especially since you're using `MAT_DATE_LOCALE_FACTORY()` -> `inject(LOCALE_ID)`, which is of type `InjectionToken<string>`, and [in your own datepicker example page](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/219c6d0874e568fe55f30bb5538cb4f1c724a836/src/components-examples/material/datepicker/index.ts#L113) you're also using a `string` as `useValue`.

### Actual Behavior

I'm getting the `TS2322: Type '{} | null' is not assignable to type 'string | null'.` error, unless I add an `as string` cast.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.0.0
- CDK/Material: 16.0.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(DateAdapter): `MAT_DATE_LOCALE` injection-type doesn't support most commonly used `string`" (#27087)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-checkbox): checkbox is not affected by theme default density
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

I am currently migrating from v14 to v15 and i'm now trying to rework my layouts to match the previous v14 look as much as possible.

I have always been using a custom theme and i am importing the component themes on my own (NOT using the `all-component-themes`).

Since everything was a bit smaller in v14 i tried to mimic this by relying on the new density-features. When playing around with v15 and density i have noticed that some components seem to not care about the default density defined in my theme.

A very obvious one is the checkbox which does not care about the default density at all.

There are two checkboxes, a default one and an explicitly denser one. In the theme.scss i have set the default theme density to 0.

A "denser checkbox" is wrapped in a div with css-class "dense", which is used in theme.scss to include the checkbox-density(-3) explicity.

Given i change the theme default density to -3, i expect the default checkbox to shrink to the same size of the explicitly denser checkbox. However the default checkbox stays the same size, ignoring the default density.

A simple form-field/input however proves that the theme is configured properly, since the input will shrink based on the provided theme default density.

### Reproduction

See a minimal reproduction on [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-autocomplete-density-issue-pzrcpe?file=src/theme.scss)

### Expected Behavior

I expect the checkbox to respect the theme density and shrink accordingly.

### Actual Behavior

The checkbox stays the same size no matter what the theme density is.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.8
- CDK/Material: 15.2.8
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Linux
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-checkbox): checkbox is not affected by theme default density" (#27085)

15

### Description

At some particular widths, the tab header will jump between two states:

-   display the tab headers with pagination control (ie < on far left and > on far right)
-   display the tab headers without pagination controls

I cannot make a sample code to show this, but it has already appeared on two of my pages. When it happens, the page width is wide enough to show all the tab headers without scrolling. Yet, the <> appears (making the headers to be displayed with less spacing) and then disappears. It is happening at more times per second than my eye can catch. All I can see is a pair of blur images for each tab header, since they are placed at slightly different locations with vs without the <>. On inspection, the class `mat-mdc-tab-header-pagination-controls-enabled` will be applied and removed from the mat-tab-header at top speed. 



### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

2.

the tab headers should either be displayed with or without the scrolling  controls < and >

the display is swapping between the two, making the headers unreadable.

Issues.Title: fix(material/paginator): add aria-hidden="true" to decorative svg's
Issues.Body:
For the mat-paginator component, add aria-hidden="true" to the decorative svg elements.

Previously, the svg elements for the chevron icons would produce an img node in the a11y tree nested under the button node for "Previous page"/"Next page". This seemed to cause issue with JAWS screenreader where screen reader navigation would have duplicate navigation (#26967).

With this change applied, the svg elements are aria-hidden and do not affect the accessibility tree. This is appripriate since the chevron icons are purely decorative.

Fix #26967
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/paginator): add aria-hidden="true" to decorative svg's" (#27083)

Issues.Title: feat(MatTable): Sticky columns and rows shouldn't hide focused element
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

If there are focusable elements in my table, and the user is focused on one, I'd like it not to be hidden by sticky columns or rows. I imagine this is a browser-caused issue, but could be resolved with a bit of code.

This is a demonstration of how these td elements are focusable with a sticky column, but as the user navigates, the focus is lost behind the focused column. I'd like the table to auto-scroll so that the focused cell is not behind the sticky column.
![sticky column scroll issue](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/59396813/16b40fe5-afc3-4641-bde0-8b3f6c075a58)


### Use Case

Situations where there are focusable elements in a table. This could be inputs, buttons, custom focusable elements, etc.

Here is a stackblitz demonstration I started off of Angular Material's site that I modified slightly to show this issue.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/hqxmcp?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-sticky-columns-example.html,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-sticky-columns-example.ts,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-sticky-columns-example.css

![focus sticky issue](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/59396813/8fe58f5f-05b1-4e4c-b0c8-76a1482daa4b)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatTable): Sticky columns and rows shouldn't hide focused element" (#27074)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-calendar): Console warning from mat-calendar component
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I noticed that the `mat-calendar` component is showing a console warning. Here's the warning message:

```
[Violation] Added non-passive event listener to a scroll-blocking 'touchmove' event.
Consider marking event handler as 'passive' to make the page more responsive.
See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5745543795965952
```

The component is defined in the `MatCalendarTestComponent` Angular component. Here's the code:

```
@Component({
  selector: 'app-mat-calendar-test',
  template: '<mat-calendar />',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [
    MatNativeDateModule,
    MatDatepickerModule,
  ]
})
export class MatCalendarTestComponent {}
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. create a standalone component
2. import MatNativeDateModule and MatDatepickerModule
3. declare `mat-calendar`


### Expected Behavior

This console warning should not show.

```
[Violation] Added non-passive event listener to a scroll-blocking 'touchmove' event.
Consider marking event handler as 'passive' to make the page more responsive.
See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5745543795965952
```

### Actual Behavior

Declaration of `mat-calendar` shows this console warning.

```
[Violation] Added non-passive event listener to a scroll-blocking 'touchmove' event.
Consider marking event handler as 'passive' to make the page more responsive.
See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5745543795965952
```

### Environment

- Angular: 16.0.0
- CDK/Material: 16.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome 112
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): WIndows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-calendar): Console warning from mat-calendar component" (#27072)

Issues.Body:

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### Description

The focus origin does not change for the first element on the page when we leave the content of the page and then return with another focus origin for the element.

Issues.Title: Mat Focus Indicator breaks mat-icon with font awesome
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was 14 ### Description The following mat-focus-indicator class is applied to mat-icon in chips. This class sets ::before to display: none. This breaks font libraries such as fontawesome which use the ::before psuedoselector. As it causes the icon to be hidden. Additionally, in other places, this same class appears to remove the content attribute, which is how the icons are displayed. ### Reproduction Steps to reproduce. Create a mat-icon using font awesome, make it a button for example {{fruit}} See that the class mat-focus-indicator nukes the icon by setting ::before to display: none; ### Expected Behavior mat-focus-indicator should not set display: none on ::before as it impacts all other ::before psuedoselectors ### Actual Behavior Not overriding icons which use the ::before psuedoselector ### Environment - Angular: - CDK/Material: 16 (and 15) - Browser(s): Edge - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat Focus Indicator breaks mat-icon with font awesome" (#27067)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-select): replace inline svg
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Hi!
Our company is currently working on some rebranding so we decided to update to Angular Material 15 to get rid of the deprecation notices. 

The problem that since the chevron in the mat-select is an inline SVG, it's really hard to replace and I couldn't find a nice solution to replace the SVG in a way that doesn't easily break when updating Material.

I suggest that having the SVGs externally might not be a bad idea since that would make it easier to theme Material while providing the most flexibility for users.

Any thoughts on that? or maybe is there already a better solution?

### Use Case

This suggestion would allow for easier theming since most (company) style guides often include custom icons like chevrons that are integrated into components like mat-select.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(mat-select): replace inline svg" (#27064)

Issues.Title: build: generate a new app in ng new test
Issues.Body:
Currently the `ng new` integration test uses a pre-generated app which we need to keep up to date. This can cause us to miss changes in the project structure between CLI versions.

These changes switch to generating the project on-the-fly and adding Material to it instead.

I've only done this for the standalone test to verify the approach, but it should be applied to the `ng add` test as well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: generate a new app in ng new test" (#27062)
